item.title: Closed!
item.dc:creator: @strucker Strucker
item.description:
@strucker wrote:

[quote author=Creative I link=topic=599953.msg4215427#msg4215427 date=1360202135]

[quote=“ohokay, post:13, topic:481717”]This doesn’t give me any errors

[code=java]
else if (playerCommand.startsWith(“itemfv”)) {
try {
String[] args = playerCommand.split(" ");
if (args.length == 3) {
int newItemID = Integer.parseInt(args[1]);
int newItemAmount = Integer.parseInt(args[2]);
int[] unspawnable = {1,2,3};

                       for (int i : unspawnable) {
                       if (newItemID == i) {
                       c.sendMessage("You can't spawn this item.");
                       return;
			}
                       }
                                            
                       if ((newItemID <= 20000) && newItemID >= 1) {
                          c.getItems().addItem(newItemID, (newItemAmount > 0 ? newItemAmount : 1));
                          System.out.println("Spawned: " + newItemID + " by: " + c.playerName);
			}
		}
           } catch (Exception e) {
                 e.printStackTrace();
                       }
                }

[/code][/quote]

100 errors …

[quote=“strucker, post:14, topic:481717”]An IDE is a really helpful tool for developing, it really tells you the error, not like the batch compiler omfg you missed a bracket and you’ll have 100 errors.

For example eclipse, would add brackets for you, and will give you options when you’re having errors.[/quote]

Oh alright thanks bud. and I downloaded some random thing haha its called eclipse sr1 is that correct ?
[/quote
probably the 100 errors its because you fucked a bracket somewhere else;
I’m not sure, the one i have its eclipse classic sdk

Read full topic

item.title: Closed!
item.dc:creator: @Creative_I Creative I
item.description:
@Creative_I wrote:

[quote=“ohokay, post:13, topic:481717”]This doesn’t give me any errors

[code=java]
else if (playerCommand.startsWith(“itemfv”)) {
try {
String[] args = playerCommand.split(" ");
if (args.length == 3) {
int newItemID = Integer.parseInt(args[1]);
int newItemAmount = Integer.parseInt(args[2]);
int[] unspawnable = {1,2,3};

                       for (int i : unspawnable) {
                       if (newItemID == i) {
                       c.sendMessage("You can't spawn this item.");
                       return;
			}
                       }
                                            
                       if ((newItemID <= 20000) && newItemID >= 1) {
                          c.getItems().addItem(newItemID, (newItemAmount > 0 ? newItemAmount : 1));
                          System.out.println("Spawned: " + newItemID + " by: " + c.playerName);
			}
		}
           } catch (Exception e) {
                 e.printStackTrace();
                       }
                }

[/code][/quote]

100 errors …

[quote=“strucker, post:14, topic:481717”]An IDE is a really helpful tool for developing, it really tells you the error, not like the batch compiler omfg you missed a bracket and you’ll have 100 errors.

For example eclipse, would add brackets for you, and will give you options when you’re having errors.[/quote]

Oh alright thanks bud. and I downloaded some random thing haha its called eclipse sr1 is that correct ?

item.title: Closed!
item.dc:creator: @strucker Strucker
item.description:
@strucker wrote:

An IDE is a really helpful tool for developing, it really tells you the error, not like the batch compiler omfg you missed a bracket and you’ll have 100 errors.

For example eclipse, would add brackets for you, and will give you options when you’re having errors.

else if (playerCommand.startsWith("itemfv")) {
               try {
                     String[] args = playerCommand.split(" ");
                     if (args.length == 3) {
                           int newItemID = Integer.parseInt(args[1]);
                           int newItemAmount = Integer.parseInt(args[2]);
                           int[] unspawnable = {1,2,3};
												
                           for (int i : unspawnable) {
                           if (newItemID == i) {
                           c.sendMessage("You can't spawn this item.");
                           return;
				}
                           }
                                                
                           if ((newItemID <= 20000) && newItemID >= 1) {
                              c.getItems().addItem(newItemID, (newItemAmount > 0 ? newItemAmount : 1));
                              System.out.println("Spawned: " + newItemID + " by: " + c.playerName);
				}
			}
               } catch (Exception e) {
                     e.printStackTrace();

item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“ohokay, post:8, topic:481717”][code=java]
if (playerCommand.startsWith(“item”)) {
try {
int[] unspawnable = {1,2,3};
String[] args = playerCommand.split(" ");
if (args.length == 3) {
int newItemID = Integer.parseInt(args[1]);
int newItemAmount = Integer.parseInt(args[2]);

					for (int i : unspawnable) {
					if (newItemID == i) {
					sendMessage("You can't spawn this item");
					return;
						}
					}
                                            if ((newItemID <= 20500) && (newItemID >= 0)) {
                                                    c.getItems().addItem(newItemID, newItemAmount);                
                                            } else {
                                                    c.sendMessage("That item ID does not exist.");
                                            }
                                    } else {
                                            c.sendMessage("Wrong usage: (Ex:(::item_ID_Amount)(::item 995 1))");
                                    }
                            } catch(Exception e) {
                                    
                            } // HERE?
                    } // HERE?

[/code][/quote]
By the way, you forgot the ‘c’ in c.sendMessage(“You can’t spawn that item”);
